description: PARIS — French President Emanuel Macron said Sunday he was dissolving the National Assembly and calling a snap legislative election after his party suffered a heavy defeat in elections for the European Parliament.
title: French President Macron calls a snap legislative election after defeat in E.U. vote

description: Iran’s Guardian Council on Sunday approved the country’s hard-line parliament speaker and five others to run in the country’s June 28 presidential election following a helicopter crash that killed President Ebrahim Raisi and seven others.
title: Iran approves 6 candidates for presidential race, but again blocks Ahmadinejad

description: NEW DELHI — Narendra Modi was sworn in Sunday for a rare third consecutive term as India’s prime minister, relying on his coalition partners after his party failed to win a parliamentary majority in a surprise outcome.
title: Modi is sworn in for a rare third term as India’s prime minister

description: Voters in 21 EU countries including France and Germany will conclude a four-day election for the European Parliament on Sunday, which is expected to shift the assembly to the right and boost the numbers of eurosceptic nationalists.
title: European Parliament poised for rightward shift after final voting

description: South Korea announced Sunday it would resume anti-North Korean propaganda loudspeaker broadcasts in border areas in retaliation to the North sending over 1000 balloons filled with trash and manure over the last couple of weeks.
title: Seoul to restart anti-Pyongyang broadcasts in retaliation to North’s trash balloons

description: MONTREAL — Ferrari and McLaren present a serious threat to Max Verstappen and Red Bull’s hopes of winning the Formula 1 world championship this year.
title: Red Bull F1 boss says Ferrari and McLaren pose threats for the championship
